column4: Certain .m4a files are really not working.  Amarok can't add them to its collection and SoundConverter can't change them to Ogg Vorbis.  They aren't .m4p files and some of them work, but not all.
Amarok was configured to use Xine... fwiw, I got m4a support from EasyUbuntu....
That package is installed, yes... version 1.1.1+ubuntu1-2
That's the thing, they can play for the most part, but Amarok craps out when trying to add them to it's collection.
are you using 1.4.3 from the kubuntu.org repo?
I got 1.4.3, but it's not from Kubuntu repos
Ubuntu 6.06 LTS, Dapper updates, and security updates
no, I meant from where did you get amarok 1.4.3?
(he's more familiar w/ amarok than I am)
